title: Land and Offerings
shortSummary: Ezekiel 45 details the division of land for the sanctuary, priests, Levites, and the prince, emphasizing holiness and justice in the allocation. It also outlines precise offerings and regulations for worship, highlighting God's call for fairness and proper worship in the restored community.
timeline: c. 6th century BC - During the Babylonian exile, prophetic vision concerning Israel's future restoration

keyCharacters.name: The Prince
keyCharacters.description: A future leader in Israel responsible for offerings and maintaining justice, distinct from the priests and Levites.

keyCharacters.name: The Priests
keyCharacters.description: Ministers of the sanctuary who serve the LORD and receive a holy portion of the land for their dwelling and service.

keyCharacters.name: The Levites
keyCharacters.description: Assistants in the house of God who receive land for their possession and chambers.

definitions.definition: An ancient Hebrew unit of dry measure, approximately equivalent to about 22 liters or 2/3 of a bushel.
A Hebrew unit of liquid measure, roughly equal to about 22 liters or 6 gallons.
An offering or gift presented to God, often as part of worship or atonement.
A large Hebrew unit of measure for grain or liquids, approximately ten baths or ephahs.

outline.heading: Division of the Holy Land and Sanctuary
outline.description: God commands the allocation of land for the sanctuary, priests, Levites, the city, and the prince, emphasizing the holiness and proper boundaries of each portion.

outline.heading: Justice and Fair Measures Mandated
outline.description: The Lord instructs the princes to cease oppression and use just weights and measures, underscoring the importance of fairness and integrity in the community.

outline.heading: The Prince’s Oblation and Offerings
outline.description: Specific offerings are prescribed for the prince to present on behalf of the people, including grain, oil, and lambs, to maintain reconciliation with God.

outline.heading: Purification and Festival Worship
outline.description: Instructions are given for cleansing the sanctuary and for the prince to prepare sin offerings and burnt offerings during key festivals, emphasizing worship and atonement.

application: Commit to integrity in all dealings by using honest measures and practicing fairness as God commands.
Recognize the importance of dedicated offerings and worship as a means of maintaining fellowship and reconciliation with God.
Value the role of godly leadership that upholds justice and leads the people in obedience to God's ordinances.
Approach worship with reverence and purity, following God's prescribed ways to honor Him rightly.

keyVerses.text: Thus saith the Lord GOD; Let it suffice you, O princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute judgment and justice, take away your exactions from my people, saith the Lord GOD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's demand for justice and the end of oppression by leaders, a timeless call for righteous governance.

keyVerses.text: Ye shall have just balances, and a just ephah, and a just bath.
keyVerses.significance: It underscores the necessity of honesty and fairness in commerce and daily life as a reflection of godly character.

keyVerses.text: And it shall be the prince's part to give burnt offerings, and meat offerings, and drink offerings, in the feasts, and in the new moons, and in the sabbaths, in all solemnities of the house of Israel: he shall prepare the sin offering, and the meat offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make reconciliation for the house of Israel.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the prince’s responsibility in leading worship and ensuring atonement, emphasizing the role of leadership in spiritual life.
